actions.text: Referred to House Committee on International Relations.

official_title: A concurrent resolution to express the sense of the Congress that Congress should be consulted prior to the commitment of significant U.S. resources for covert military operations abroad.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Congress that no department or agency of the Government of the United States should make any significant financial, material or human contribution for covert military operations abroad without first consulting Congress.

titles.title: A concurrent resolution to express the sense of the Congress that Congress should be consulted prior to the commitment of significant U.S. resources for covert military operations abroad.
